law.text: Notwithstanding KRS 278.040(2), or any other provision to the contrary, any utility, cable service provider, or satellite broadcast and wireless cable service provider required to pay the tax authorized by KRS 160.613 or 160.614 may increase its rates in any school district in which it is required to pay the school tax by the amount of the school tax imposed, up to three percent (3%). Any utility, cable service provider, or satellite broadcast and wireless cable service provider so increasing its rates shall separately state on the bills sent to its customers the amount of the increase and shall identify the amount as: "Rate increase for school tax."
law.history: Amended 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 168, sec. 131, effective March 18, 2005. -- Amended 2004 Ky. Acts ch. 79, sec. 13, effective July 1, 2005. -- Repealed and reenacted 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. V, sec. 464, effective July 13, 1990. -- Amended 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 127, sec. 13. -- Created 1966 Ky. Acts ch. 24, Part III, sec. 11.
